irgroupproject.tbn
Class InvertedIndex

java.lang.Object
  irgroupproject.tbn.InvertedIndex

public class InvertedIndex
extends java.lang.Object

Inverted index class. This is a hybrid of the inverted index we discussed for document indexing and your basic adjacency list representation of a graph. For each node, we store all nodes connected to that node with a directed edge and we also store an edge type of the set {BROAD, NARROW, RELATED}.

For actually storing the index, we use a Hashtable that has String keys and a HashSet (or InvertedIndexList) of values. The HashSet stores InvertedIndexItem objects which consist of the term name and the relationship existing between the two terms.

Given our requirements of 20-25 terms and only searching one level deep, this representation was both efficient in storage and speed and also presented the easiest method of construction. Though searching the entire list is O(n), our knowledge that n is so small makes this of little concern.

Designed to support multi-threaded access.

Author:
kurtisthompson

Method Detail

isNewConcept

public boolean isNewConcept(Concept c)
Checks to see if a passed in Concept exists in our index currently or not. Method is synchronized to facilitate multi-threaded access.

Parameters:
c - Concept to check our index for.
Returns:
True if Concept does not exist in our index. False otherwise.

addConcept

public void addConcept(Concept c)
Adds a Concept to our TBN index assuming it does not already exist. If it does, we do nothing. Method is synchronized to facilitate multi-threaded access.

Parameters:
c - Concept to add to our index.

updateConcept

public void updateConcept(Concept old_concept,
                          Concept new_concept)
Updates a Concept. Replaced one concept with another in the index while maintaining relationships. Method is synchronized to facilitate multi-threaded access.

Parameters:
old_concept - Concept to replace
new_concept - Concept to put in the place of old_concept.

addItem

public void addItem(Concept c,
                    InvertedIndexItem i)
Added a new item to our InvertedIndexList for a given Concept. Method is synchronized to facilitate thread safe access.

Parameters:
c - Concept whose list we will add the InvertedIndexItem to.
i - InvertedIndexItem to add to the list corresponding to the Concept c.

getConceptList

public InvertedIndexList getConceptList(Concept c)
Returns the entire InvertedIndexList for a given concept. Method is synchronized to facilitate multi-threaded access.

Parameters:
c - Concept whose list we should return.
Returns:
InvertedIndexList for the concept or null, if one does not exist.

removeConcept

public void removeConcept(Concept c)
Removes a concept and all of it's relationships from our index. Reciprocal relationships are also removed to maintain consistency. Method is synchronized to facilitate multi-threaded access.

Parameters:
c - Concept to remove from our index.

printIndex

public void printIndex()

getIndex

public java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,java.util.HashSet<InvertedIndexItem>> getIndex()
Returns the underling HashTable implementation of our index. Should generally not be used for anything other than complete index traversal.

Method is NOT Thread-Safe.

Returns:
Pointer to our index hashtable.

persistIndex

public void persistIndex(java.lang.String path)
                  throws java.io.IOException
Save our index to disk at the given path. Method uses simple java Object streams to persist the object. Method is thread-safe.

Parameters:
path - - Path to save our index to.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - - Thrown if path is not accessible.

loadIndexFromFile

public void loadIndexFromFile(java.lang.String path)
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Try and load our persisted index from the given path.

Parameters:
path - - Path where our persisted index is saved.
Throws:
